title: Don’t Cancel the Classics, Broaden and Diversify Them
sub_head: Black Americans in past centuries fought for the right to be educated in Western civilization.
body:
The knives are out for Julius Caesar again—and Homer too.
As Tennessee expands possibilities for new charter schools, critics are assailing classical education. Some of these schools teach students about the sages and scoundrels of ancient Greece and Rome. In the New Republic, Annie Abrams, a public-school teacher from New York, complains that these schools promote “retreat from the public sphere” along with Christian humanism” “nationalistic exaltation of ‘Western civilization.’ ”
